title: bigasic
author: bigasic
content: Ive stayed away for the last few years, but im back.. I see a lot of old but wow, so many new faces...Bitcoin sure has come along way since I opened my first account here in early 2011..

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: bigasic on August 17, 2023, 04:37:03 PMIve stayed away for the last few years, but im back.. I see a lot of old but wow, so many new faces...Bitcoin sure has come along way since I opened my first account here in early 2011..It's good to have you back here, and it's good you didn't lose access to the account and can still remember your login details. I guess the forum is still the same as always, just with new faces, and nothing much has changed. 2019 is not that far away.It's good to have some old forum members back and I hope to see you around again. For the record; Your account creation date is showing 2012 and not 2011 üòè¬†But I don't think this topic is best suited for Bitcoin discussion. Maybe reputation or some other board that permits self-introduction, and all of that can be done.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: This raises a lot of suspicion, What is the need announcing that you are back?Your account just woke up for the first time since 8/9/2022 and last post made even farther in the past (January 2019). What have you been up to? and why will a "Hero member" not know that making a post about them being back is unnecessary and a spam.

comments.author: Hyphen(-)
comments.body: Quote from: bigasic on August 17, 2023, 04:37:03 PMIve stayed away for the last few years, but im back.. I see a lot of old but wow, so many new faces...Bitcoin sure has come along way since I opened my first account here in early 2011..Hello, and welcome back! We are delighted you returned to the Bitcointalk forum; surprisingly, you have been away from the forum for a long time, but you remember your log-in information correctly. According to your post history from 2019, you have not been very active in the forum, with less than five postings in 2020.Now that you're back, I hope you've gotten back into the flow of things on the forum, because I believe you still remember the forum's rules and regulations. Welcome back once more.

comments.author: bigasic
comments.body: Quote from: Rruchi man on August 17, 2023, 05:01:05 PMThis raises a lot of suspicion, What is the need announcing that you are back?Your account just woke up for the first time since 8/9/2022 and last post made even farther in the past (January 2019). What have you been up to? and why will a "Hero member" not know that making a post about them being back is unnecessary and a spam. you are correct. I wanted to see if i could remember my log in, i did and made an impulsive post.. My bad.. Moderator, please deleteIll go back to my slumber...

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Do you also have 1005 BTC in your holdings!!. hehe just kidding because you also become active today after a long time and I have also never seen you before here I registered here in 2021 so you are my senior too. I asked that question because I just head the news someone just transferred 1005 BTC today after 13 years and so I thought that might be you because you said you are here since 2011 and people who are old here mostly have that much BTC.Whether you have or not, I am not interested, hehe. And you do not need to say yes too. But welcome again here I hope you will find some interesting things that could engage you here.

comments.author: Yatsan
comments.body: Quote from: bigasic on August 17, 2023, 04:37:03 PMIve stayed away for the last few years, but im back.. I see a lot of old but wow, so many new faces...Bitcoin sure has come along way since I opened my first account here in early 2011..Wow! But yes, many things have changed not only in this forum but also with the market price of cryptos as we can see. If your comeback is concerning things in this forum then there's this new system of ranking up procedure which will require you a particular number of merits. Also with projects, mostly are signature campaigns and only a few are succeeding in this industry. It is in between being good and not. As others have mentioned, most of us would be curious of your token holdings especially for being an early investor. But one thing is assured; this industry is still growing in line with what we are believing when it comes at being one. If you are planning to cope up with this industry's progress¬† then it will never be too late to do so.

comments.author: Zlantann
comments.body: Quote from: bigasic on August 17, 2023, 05:22:52 PMQuote from: Rruchi man on August 17, 2023, 05:01:05 PMThis raises a lot of suspicion, What is the need announcing that you are back?Your account just woke up for the first time since 8/9/2022 and last post made even farther in the past (January 2019). What have you been up to? and why will a "Hero member" not know that making a post about them being back is unnecessary and a spam. you are correct. I wanted to see if i could remember my log in, i did and made an impulsive post.. My bad. Moderator, please deleteI'll go back to my slumber...You don't need to go back to slumber because of an observation. @Rruchi man is just concerned because of some challenges such as account hacks and sells. We want to be sure that you are the real owner of the account and what you are saying is true. I am happy that you are back in the forum because your positive contribution to the forum will be helpful to the community. Also if you think that the forum was helpful to you and you enjoyed the forum before you became inactive then just a simple observation should not make you leave. If you are passionate to learn and interact with like-minds, a little criticism shouldn't deter you. You are welcome back.

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.created_time: August 17, 2023, 06:38:02 PMLast edit: August 17, 2023, 06:49:27 PM by Majestic-milf
comments.body: Quote from: bigasic on August 17, 2023, 04:37:03 PMIve stayed away for the last few years, but im back.. I see a lot of old but wow, so many new faces...Bitcoin sure has come along way since I opened my first account here in early 2011.. Welcome back to the land of the living, lol. Yeah, Bitcoin has come a long way but nothing really has changed much, price still as volatile as ever. The forum has more new faces which indicates growth and I hope to see more input from you. From your username and posts you created over the years while you were active, it shows you dig mining equipments and may know a thing or two that newbies would benefit from.

comments.author: bigasic
comments.body: Quote from: Yatsan on August 17, 2023, 05:50:26 PMQuote from: bigasic on August 17, 2023, 04:37:03 PMIve stayed away for the last few years, but im back.. I see a lot of old but wow, so many new faces...Bitcoin sure has come along way since I opened my first account here in early 2011..Wow! But yes, many things have changed not only in this forum but also with the market price of cryptos as we can see. If your comeback is concerning things in this forum then there's this new system of ranking up procedure which will require you a particular number of merits. Also with projects, mostly are signature campaigns and only a few are succeeding in this industry. It is in between being good and not. As others have mentioned, most of us would be curious of your token holdings especially for being an early investor. But one thing is assured; this industry is still growing in line with what we are believing when it comes at being one. If you are planning to cope up with this industry's progress¬† then it will never be too late to do so.I cant believe how things have changed.. I remember my first bitcoin purchase with Jeb Mcaleb (sp?) on mt. gox before ¬†Karpeles purchased it. It was pretty cool, email and paypal, thats how I bought my first btc, lol. then i mined the shit out of them for years..Im a hard bitcoiner now. Damn near a maxi now...no, Ill say it, Im a bitcoin maxi,. Sure, Ive been into a lot shit coins, worked for wagerr, and Beaxy.. so, Bitcoin has been pretty good for me over he last decade or so...I just learned that if you trade or buy anything but bitcoin, youll only get burned in the end. I was in the ETH ICO and Tezos ico, list goes on..bitcoin will always be king. there is no second best. Took me too long to figure that out..Thanks

comments.author: bigasic
comments.body: Quote from: Zlantann on August 17, 2023, 06:33:30 PMQuote from: bigasic on August 17, 2023, 05:22:52 PMQuote from: Rruchi man on August 17, 2023, 05:01:05 PMThis raises a lot of suspicion, What is the need announcing that you are back?Your account just woke up for the first time since 8/9/2022 and last post made even farther in the past (January 2019). What have you been up to? and why will a "Hero member" not know that making a post about them being back is unnecessary and a spam. you are correct. I wanted to see if i could remember my log in, i did and made an impulsive post.. My bad. Moderator, please deleteI'll go back to my slumber...You don't need to go back to slumber because of an observation. @Rruchi man is just concerned because of some challenges such as account hacks and sells. We want to be sure that you are the real owner of the account and what you are saying is true. I am happy that you are back in the forum because your positive contribution to the forum will be helpful to the community. Also if you think that the forum was helpful to you and you enjoyed the forum before you became inactive then just a simple observation should not make you leave. If you are passionate to learn and interact with like-minds, a little criticism shouldn't deter you. You are welcome back. Yes, you are right.. But Rruchi is also correct.. I hate scammers, etc..¬† I have been a target of scammers and hackers since the end of Silk Road. If I can help one person, it will be worth it.. but yes, I CPU mined, GPU, FPGAs and as you can tell by my posts was one of the first to receive and mine with ASICsIf you need more verification that I am who i say i am, just let me know.. or dont, lol. I know who i am I am not here to sell or have any agenda. Thats not true, I do have an agenda.. To spread the word of bitcoin..

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: Quote from: bigasic on August 17, 2023, 04:37:03 PMIve stayed away for the last few years, but im back.. I see a lot of old but wow, so many new faces...Bitcoin sure has come along way since I opened my first account here in early 2011.. Welcome back to the forum, probably you went for your Honey Moon for a long vacation and also forgot to come back but it's like you just re-registered your in the forum from the previous account (you just remembered the forum). Yes the forum has changed and a lot of people have join the forum from different countries which makes the forum more populated. Bitcoin has come to live and nobody can do it anything again.

comments.author: Smartvirus
comments.body: Quote from: bigasic on August 17, 2023, 04:37:03 PMso many new faces...Bitcoin sure has come along way since I opened my first account here in early 2011..Am just curious, what happened to your first account again?Also, for an old user of the forum, you ought to be aware that posting consecutive times counts as spam and should be avoided as, you could have cramped the posts in one. At the moment you don‚Äôt have a motive other than increasing activity for a just revamped account but, that‚Äôs not a justifier for what is being done (spam).Also, this board feel like the best place to announce your awakening. It‚Äôs a bitcoin discussion board, reputation or even beginners & help of which, doesn‚Äôt seem best could have been okay than this.Your last messages to the forum dates back to 2019/18/13 and single messages‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs strange!

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Quote from: Faisal2202 on August 17, 2023, 05:44:25 PM people who are old here mostly have that much BTC.Whether you have or not, I am not interested, hehe. And you do not need to say yes too. But welcome again here I hope you will find some interesting things that could engage you here. Well that's not accurate and it's just assumptions, there are many people who hold lots of Bitcoin that has not even yet joined the forum or are just joining in on it. The age of an account does not determine how much Bitcoin the account owners own, correct that mistake because some ideology can get you scammed.

comments.author: panganib999
comments.body: Suspicions aside, we're glad you're back. Lot of stuff changed drastically from the years you've been gone. The forum itself had a little paradigm shift every now and again. Bitcoin's still going pretty strong and has been steadily increasing in value since 2012, and a couple more. coincidentally though your logins coincided with the times that whales transferred large sums of bitcoin in between accounts, I'm not really sure if it's any cause for concern nor if it was you (which I doubt you would come forward if it was really you anyway but whatever) but I guess it's good to know. Anywho, welcome back to the forum, take yourself to a little tour. It's still pretty much the same thing although new pioneers have come up who imparted awesome stuff to this site and to bitcoin as a whole. hope you'd stick around this time to share your own stuff with us, be it knowledge or stories!

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Welcome back to the forum, but to be frank with you I don‚Äôt really see any use of this thread. The only thing that this thread will lead to is your account becoming suspicious and because of that it will be investigated and if it turns out that you bought the account or the account was hacked you‚Äôll be called out and eventually receive some neg-tags.You should also take your time to check out how the forum has changed since you last time you came to the forum. A lot of developments has occurred in the crypto space so you should also try to get updated with the latest updates and continue with discussions here in the forum. I do hope your account is not a bought account.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: It appears that you've returned during a bearish trend. Nevertheless, welcome back to the forum! There have been numerous changes since you were last here, so take some time to review the forum rules and related updates. The cryptocurrency market has experienced significant changes as well. If you've also been distant from crypto, consider studying the charts to catch up on everything.

comments.author: Pokapoka124
comments.body: Quote from: bigasic on August 17, 2023, 04:37:03 PMIve stayed away for the last few years, but im back.. I see a lot of old but wow, so many new faces...Bitcoin sure has come along way since I opened my first account here in early 2011..I would say it‚Äôs been more than a few years. Welcome back to the forum, your account is an old one. It‚Äôs nice to see an old member being active here. Though I don‚Äôt think this is the right board for this kind of message. Reputation board would be a better fit for this sort of topic. I‚Äôm curious, why now? It‚Äôs bearish season, it‚Äôs quite odd that you would remember your old bitcointalk account in such times.

comments.author: Aikidoka
comments.body: Welcome back to the forum but I don‚Äôt see any reason of you creating this topic here as a lot of members mentioned that there‚Äôs no need to do it in a bitcoin discussion section, but yeah I‚Äôm glad that you still remember your password and you never lost it since it‚Äôs such a pretty old account that‚Äôs made on 2012. I hope you‚Äôll be active again and you won‚Äôt go for a sleep time again. Best of luck in your future man!

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Quote from: bigasic on August 17, 2023, 04:37:03 PMIve stayed away for the last few years, but im back.. I see a lot of old but wow, so many new faces...Bitcoin sure has come along way since I opened my first account here in early 2011..It's good you are back mate. I believe you are back here with a good, better and stronger perspective to add more to the forum as a high rank member you are but I was wondering if it was typo or something else that you mentioned 2011 but I am seeing 2012 on your profile. However, I will advise you edit it and make corrections there so as not to get people confused or possibly doubt your authenticity here. Good to see an old member back onboard. I know you must have noticed some sort of changes in participants or possibly members here compared to years back when this platform was just starting. Nice to see you active again.
